register.description: IP Revision Identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility
IP Revision Identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility

bitenum.description: Both clocks can be cut off
Only OCP clock must be kept active; system clock can be cut off
Both clocks must be kept active
Only system clock must be kept active; OCP clock can be cut off

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Bus busy status.Writing into this bit has no effect.
Receive overrun status.Writing into this bit has no effect.
Transmit underflow status.Writing into this bit has no effect.
Address recognized as slave IRQ status.
General call IRQ status. Set to 1 by core when General call address detected and interrupt signaled to MPUSS.
Transmit data ready IRQ status. Set to 1 by core when transmitter and when new data is requested. When set to 1 by core, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS.
Receive data ready IRQ status. Set to 1 by core when receiver mode, a new data is able to be read. When set to 1 by core, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS.
Register access ready IRQ status. When set to 1 it indicates that previous access has been performed and registers are ready to be accessed again. An interrupt is signaled to MPUSS.
No acknowledgement IRQ status. Bit is set when No Acknowledge has been received, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS.
Arbitration lost IRQ status. This bit is automatically set by the hardware when it loses the Arbitration in master transmit mode, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. During reads, it always returns 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Bus busy enabled status.Writing into this bit has no effect.
Receive overrun enabled status.Writing into this bit has no effect.
Transmit underflow enabled status.Writing into this bit has no effect.
Address recognized as slave IRQ enabled status.
General call IRQ enabled status. Set to 1 by core when General call address detected and interrupt signaled to MPUSS. Write 1 to clear.
Transmit data ready IRQ enabled status. Set to 1 by core when transmitter and when new data is requested. When set to 1 by core, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. Write 1 to clear.
Receive data ready IRQ enabled status. Set to 1 by core when receiver mode, a new data is able to be read. When set to 1 by core, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. Write 1 to clear.

Register access ready IRQ enabled status. When set to 1 it indicates that previous access has been performed and registers are ready to be accessed again. An interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. Write 1 to clear.
No acknowledgement IRQ enabled status. Bit is set when No Acknowledge has been received, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. Write 1 to clear this bit.

Arbitration lost IRQ enabled status. This bit is automatically set by the hardware when it loses the Arbitration in master transmit mode, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. During reads, it always returns 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Transmit Draining interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[XDR].
Receive Draining interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[RDR].
Addressed as Slave interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[AAS].
Bus Free interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[BF].
Access Error interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[AERR].
Start Condition interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[STC].
General call Interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[GC]
Transmit data ready interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[XRDY]
Receive data ready interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[RRDY]
Register access ready interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[ARDY]
No acknowledgement interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[NACK]
Arbitration lost interrupt enable set. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[AL]
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Transmit Draining interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[XDR].
Receive Draining interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[RDR].
Addressed as Slave interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[AAS].
Bus Free interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[BF].
Access Error interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[AERR].
Start Condition interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[STC].
General call Interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[GC]
Transmit data ready interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[XRDY]
Receive data ready interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[RRDY]
Register access ready interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[ARDY]
No acknowledgement interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[NACK]
Arbitration lost interrupt enable clear. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[AL]
Address as slave IRQ wakeup set.
Receive/Transmit data ready IRQ wakeup set.
Register access ready IRQ wakeup set.
Address as slave IRQ wakeup set.
Receive/Transmit data ready IRQ wakeup set.
Register access ready IRQ wakeup set.
Address as slave IRQ wakeup set.
Receive/Transmit data ready IRQ wakeup set.
Register access ready IRQ wakeup set.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Transmit Draining interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[XDR].
Receive Draining interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[RDR].
Addressed as Slave interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[AAS].
Bus Free interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[BF].
Access Error interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[AERR].
Start Condition interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[STC].
General call Interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[GC]
Transmit data ready interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[XRDY]
Receive data ready interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[RRDY]
Register access ready interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[ARDY]
No acknowledgement interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[NACK]
Arbitration lost interrupt enable. Mask or unmask the interrupt signaled by bit inI2C_STAT[AL]
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Bus busy status.Writing into this bit has no effect.
Receive overrun status.Writing into this bit has no effect.
Transmit underflow status.Writing into this bit has no effect.
Address recognized as slave IRQ status.
General call IRQ status. Set to 1 by core when General call address detected and interrupt signaled to MPUSS. Write 1 to clear.
Transmit data ready IRQ status. Set to 1 by core when transmitter and when new data is requested. When set to 1 by core, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. Write 1 to clear.
Receive data ready IRQ status. Set to 1 by core when receiver mode, a new data is able to be read. When set to 1 by core, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. Write 1 to clear.
Register access ready IRQ status. When set to 1 it indicates that previous access has been performed and registers are ready to be accessed again. An interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. Write 1 to clear.
No acknowledgement IRQ status. Bit is set when No Acknowledge has been received, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. Write 1 to clear this bit.
Arbitration lost IRQ status. This bit is automatically set by the hardware when it loses the Arbitration in master transmit mode, an interrupt is signaled to MPUSS. During reads, it always returns 0.
Threshold value for FIFO buffer in RX mode
Threshold value for FIFO buffer in TX mode
Data count Because the transfer length for DCOUNT = 0x0000 is 65536, the module does not allow the initiation of zero-data-byte transfers.

bitenum.description: Controller in reset. FIFO are cleared and status bits are set to their default value
No action or stop condition detected
No action or start condition detected

bitfield.description: Fast/Standard mode prescale sampling clock divider value 0x0: Divide by 1 0x1: Divide by 2 .............................. 0xFF: Divide by 256
High Speed mode SCL low time
High Speed mode SCL high time

bitenum.description: Normal mode. All others bits in register are read only
System test enabled. Permit other system test registers bits to be set

Stop mode (on breakpoint condition). If Master mode, it stops after completion of the ongoing bit transfer. In slave mode, it stops during the phase transfer when 1 byte is completely transmitted/received.
Loop back mode select + SDA/SCL IO mode select
Test of SCL counters (SCLL, SCLH, PSC). SCL provides a permanent clock with master mode.

bitfield.description: Enable I2C Clock Blocking for Own Address 3.
Enable I2C Clock Blocking for Own Address 2.
Enable I2C Clock Blocking for Own Address 1.
Enable I2C Clock Blocking for Own Address 0.
